meanings.definition: Relating to or derived from ants
meanings.sent1: The formic behavior of the ants was fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the formic characteristics of different ant species.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a formic gathering when the ants discovered the food.
meanings.sent4: Her work ethic was as diligent as the formic nature of an ant colony.
meanings.sent5: The formic scent of the ant trail guided the rest of the colony to the food source.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to formic acid
meanings.sent1: The formic acid solution was used in the experiment.
meanings.sent2: Formic substances are commonly found in nature.
meanings.sent3: The formic acid spill caused quite a stir in the laboratory.
meanings.sent4: Her skin felt a burning sensation from the formic acid exposure.
meanings.sent5: The formic acid's pungent smell filled the room, making everyone uncomfortable.

meanings.sent1: His formic movements mimicked those of an ant carrying a leaf.
meanings.sent2: The formic appearance of the sculpture was strikingly realistic.
meanings.sent3: The formic costume at the party was a big hit among the guests.
meanings.sent4: Her formic instincts kicked in when she organized her workspace meticulously.
meanings.sent5: The formic structure of the ant hill amazed the onlookers with its complexity.
